The word of God is to lie at the foundation of all the work done in our schools. And the students are to be taught the true dignity of labor. They are to be shown that God is a constant worker. Let every teacher take hold heartily with a group of students, working with them, and teaching them how to work. As the teachers do this, they will gain a 
                                                                           33
valuable experience. Their hearts will be bound up with the hearts of the students, and this will open the way for successful teaching.--Review and Herald, Vol. 84, No. 30, 1907.
